alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Floyd; Knott; Leslie; Magoffin; Owsley; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 4:52PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF BREATHITT...PERRY... FLOYD...PIKE...KNOTT...OWSLEY...MAGOFFIN...AND LESLIE COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow accompanied by winds of 20 MPH. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 451 PM EST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from Orchard to Ricetown and moving east at 35 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Martin, Buckhorn, Mid, Buck, Noble, Morris Fork, Copland, Little, Pyramid and Wolf Coal around 455 PM EST. Garret, Printer, Bolyn, Buckhorn Lake S.P., Lamont, Porter Junction, Hunter, Ary, Chavies and Dice around 500 PM EST. Estill, Wayland, Glo, Talcum, Dana, Drift, Yellow Mountain, Honaker, Bearville and Betty around 505 PM EST. Mosley Bend, Emmalena, Orkney, Aluba, Soft Shell, Confluence, East McDowell, Harold, Fisty and Tina around 510 PM EST. Pikeville, Hazard, Hindman, Coal Run Village, Toulouse, Osborn, Bulan, Boldman, Larkslane and Price around 515 PM EST. Cordia, Beaver, Coal Run, Hollybush and Hi Hat around 520 PM EST. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 52 and 59. Kentucky Highway 80 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 10. Kentucky Highway 80 in Knott County between mile markers 1 and 20. Kentucky Highway 80 in Perry County between mile markers 9 and 15. U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County between mile markers 14 and 26, and near mile marker 28. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
